DataElement.preferredName: Functional Tests Domain Headphones Audiometry Testing Clinical Evaluation Ear Hearing Threshold in Decibels Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The threshold value of ear hearing evaluated by headphones audiometry test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Functional Tests Domain Headphones Audiometry Testing Clinical Evaluation Ear Hearing Threshold Value
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to a functional test.:An audiometry test where the subject wears headphones and hears a range of sounds directed to one ear at a time._An assessment of an individual's physical, mental, or emotional condition; information can be gathered from multiple sources, including physical exam, personal interview and observation, medical history, laboratory and imaging tests._A sense organ needed for the detection of sound and for establishing balance. The outer ear consists of the auricle, the ear canal as well as the tympanic membrane. The middle ear is made up of an air-filled cavity behind the tympanic membrane that contains the ossicles (malleus, incus and stapes). The inner ear is made up of the cochlea needed for hearing and the vestibular apparatus required for balance._The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear._The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to a functional test.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to a functional test.

Property.preferredName: Headphones Audiometry Testing Clinical Evaluation Ear Hearing Threshold Value
Property.preferredDefinition: An audiometry test where the subject wears headphones and hears a range of sounds directed to one ear at a time._An assessment of an individual's physical, mental, or emotional condition; information can be gathered from multiple sources, including physical exam, personal interview and observation, medical history, laboratory and imaging tests._A sense organ needed for the detection of sound and for establishing balance. The outer ear consists of the auricle, the ear canal as well as the tympanic membrane. The middle ear is made up of an air-filled cavity behind the tympanic membrane that contains the ossicles (malleus, incus and stapes). The inner ear is made up of the cochlea needed for hearing and the vestibular apparatus required for balance._The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear._The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: An audiometry test where the subject wears headphones and hears a range of sounds directed to one ear at a time.

An assessment of an individual's physical, mental, or emotional condition; information can be gathered from multiple sources, including physical exam, personal interview and observation, medical history, laboratory and imaging tests.

A sense organ needed for the detection of sound and for establishing balance. The outer ear consists of the auricle, the ear canal as well as the tympanic membrane. The middle ear is made up of an air-filled cavity behind the tympanic membrane that contains the ossicles (malleus, incus and stapes). The inner ear is made up of the cochlea needed for hearing and the vestibular apparatus required for balance.
The auditory faculty, the perception of sound by the ear.
The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Audiogram Testing Result in Decibels Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Result of audiogram testing; the decibel threshold level of each ear in response to measured frequency levels of sound.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
